thread.title: RPI football's rally comes up short against St. Lawrence
thread.title_full: RPI football's rally comes up short against St. Lawrence - Times Union

author: Staff reports
title: RPI football's rally comes up short against St. Lawrence
text:
The St. Lawrence University football team held off a late RPI rally and won 24-21 on Saturday in a battle for first place atop the Liberty League standings in Canton.
St. Lawrence took a 24-0 halftime advantage into the locker room before RPI answered with 21 unanswered second-half points. But RPI just fell short of keeping its unbeaten Liberty League record intact. The Saints climbed to 5-1 overall and 3-0 in the league, while the Engineers dropped to 4-2 and 2-1 in Liberty League play.
RPI started the second half with an 11-play, 83-yard drive that was capped by senior Nick Schlatz's 1-yard touchdown plunge.
The Engineers trailed 24-7 going into the fourth quarter before quarterback Jeff Avery connected with receiver Joey Giacone on a 25-yard touchdown strike to pull within 10 points, 24-14.
RPI forced a St. Lawrence punt on its next possession, and Avery marched the Engineers down the field 67 yards, all through the air, and ended the drive with a 2-yard touchdown pass to Johnny Ramsdell to make it 24-21 with only one minute, eight seconds left.
RPI attempted an onside kick, but it was recovered by St. Lawrence, which ran out the clock.
Avery finished with 348 yards for the Engineers, who host Rochester at 12:05 next Saturday afternoon at ECAV Stadium in Troy.
